title: Flow Observed schema
description: The data model intended to measure an observation linked to the movement of an object at a certain location and over a given period. This Data Model proposes an evolution of two Data Model by merging them and integrating all the attributes of the initial version of [TrafficFlowObserved] and [CrowFlowObserved] and by extension any type of object that we want to analyze the movements. The value of the attribute `Type` can have different values corresponding to the `ObjectType` and the Flow Observed (Traffic, Crow, Bike, Boat, ...). The attribute `vehicleType` and `vehicleSubType` are modified to become a generic relations `itemType` and `itemSubType` or list of possible values. The relation will be directly defined by the 'urn:ngsi-ld':'itemType':xxxxxx' or 'urn: ngsi-ld:'itemSubType': xxxxxx' or list of data regarding standard for.

type.description: Property. NGSI Entity type. It has to be ObjectFlowObserved

anyOf.description: Property. Identifier format of any NGSI entity
Property. Identifier format of any NGSI entity

refDevice.description: Relationship. The device or devices used to obtain the data expressed by this record

anyOf.description: Property. Identifier format of any NGSI entity
Property. Identifier format of any NGSI entity

refRoadSegment.description: Relationship. Concerned road segment on which the observation has been made

dateObservedFrom.description: Property. Observation period : Start date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format.

dateObservedTo.description: Property. Observation period : End date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format.

itemType.description: Property. Reference to an [item Type](https://github.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.XXX/blob/master/XXX/doc/spec.md) allowed to complete the information if needed. Enum:'people, ship, vehicle'

itemSubType.description: Property. Reference to an [Item Sub Type](https://github.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.&Domain/blob/master/&EntytySubType/doc/spec.md) allowed to complete the information if needed.

laneId.description: Property. Lane identifier. Lane identification is done using the conventions defined by RoadSegment entity which are based on [OpenStreetMap](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Forward_%26_backward,_left_%26_right).

laneDirection.description: Property. Usual direction of travel in the lane referred by this observation. This attribute is useful when the observation is not referencing any road segment, allowing to know the direction of travel of the traffic flow observed. See RoadSegment for a description of the semantics of these values.

reversedLane.description: Property. Flags whether traffic in the lane was reversed during the observation period. The absence of this attribute means no lane reversion

intensity.description: Property. Total number of items detected during this observation period

occupancy.description: Property. Fraction of the observation time where a vehicle has been occupying the observed lane

congested.description: Property. Flags whether there was a crowd congestion during the observation period in the referred walkway. The absence of this attribute means no crowd congestion

averageSpeed.description: Property. Average speed of detected objects transiting during the observation period. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes) . Depending the type of Flow, the value can be **KMH** f(vehicule, pedestrian, etc.) represents Kilometer per hour (km/h) or **KNT** represents Knot (Boat).

averageLength.description: Property. Average length of detected objects transiting during the observation period. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes) . For instance, **MTR** represents Meter.

averageHeadwayTime.description: Property. Average headway time. Head away time is the time elapsed between two consecutive items. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **SEC** represents Second.

averageGapDistance.description: Property. Average gap distance between consecutive 2 detected items. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **MTR** represents Meter.

speedMin.description: Property. Minimum speed detected during the observation period. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes) . Depending the type of Flow, the value can be **KMH** (vehicule, pedestrian, ...) represents Kilometer per hour (km/h) or **KNT** represents Knot (Boat).

speedMax.description: Property. Maximum speed detected during the observation period. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes) . Depending the type of Flow, the value can be **KMH** (vehicule, pedestrian, ...) represents Kilometer per hour (km/h) or **KNT** represents Knot (Boat).
